title: Thai Dumpling Soup
subtitle: Comforting red-curry soup with tofu and gyozas.

ingredients.note: or ½ large red onion, thinly sliced
reduce if you prefer less heat
1 Trader Joe's vegetarian gyoza pack (about 16 dumplings)

instructions.text: Crush ginger, garlic, and chiles with a pinch of salt in a mortar and pestle to form a coarse paste (optional: add coriander stems).
Heat avocado oil in a heavy pot over medium heat. Add sliced shallots and sauté about 2 minutes until translucent.
Add sliced green bell pepper and sauté 2 minutes more.
Reduce heat to low, add the ginger-garlic-chili paste, and sauté 2 minutes.
Stir in red curry paste and cook on low, stirring constantly, until the raw aroma dissipates (4 - 5 minutes).
Add mushrooms, season lightly with salt, and sauté until they release their moisture.
Pour in about 5 cups of hot water and bring to a boil.
Stir in coconut milk, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and brown sugar. Taste and adjust salt. Bring back to a gentle boil.
Gently add cubed tofu and return to a simmer.
Add frozen gyozas, cover, and simmer about 10 minutes until the dumplings are heated through.
instructions.note: Add only as many gyozas as you'll serve immediately; when reheating leftovers, drop in fresh frozen gyozas so they stay intact.

instructions.text: Serve hot. For leftovers, reheat the broth and add fresh gyozas just before serving so they stay intact.

story: I was inspired by a recipe I saw online and gave it a twist of my own. My husband loves this soup and I love making it for him. It's easy, comforting, and perfect for the winter months.
